newsitem.title: USA: Rubbermaid to sell unit, get gain, write-off.
newsitem.headline: Rubbermaid to sell unit, get gain, write-off.

text.p: Rubbermaid Inc said Thursday it will sell its office products business to Newell Co and record a one-time gain of about $78 million after taxes, or $0.52 per share, from the sale.
Rubbermaid said in a release that it reached a definitive agreement to sell its Tennessee-based office products business to Illinois-based Newell Co for $246.5 million.

In a separate action, Rubbermaid said it will take a $61 million after-tax, or $0.41 cents per share, write-off on certain intangible assets, primarily related to acquisitions now integrated into its four core businesses.
The company said it expects the transaction to close in the second quarter, subject to filings, and plans to record both the gain and write-off in the second quarter of 1997.
Rubbermaid said the sale includes the unit's manufacturing and distribution facilities, related equipment and inventory, and the Eldon and MicroComputer Accessories brands.
Rubbermaid said it will combine its home and seasonal units into one business to "further focus on competitive strengths and better align operations to meet customer needs."
Rubbermaid said the structural changes are the last in the company's two-year realignment plan.

The company said it is now centered on four leading, brand-driven core businesses: Rubbermaid for its Home Products and Commercial Products businesses; Little Tikes for juvenile products; and Graco for infant products.

With the implementation of organizational changes to achieve this structure, Rubbermaid said it will revise its realignment cost estimate by an additional $16 million pre-tax or $9 million after taxes, amounting to $0.06 per share.
The company said that in "going forward, (it) will proceed with plans to expand (its) key businesses, pursue strategic acquisitions and continue (its) share-repurchase program."
